Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but away from main tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel in April 2012 and found that the rooms were spacious and very clean. The staff were helpful but the hotel itself is away from the main tourist area. There are good links to the main area from the tram which is located 50m in front of the hotel. We decided to get the Metro to the hotel from the airport. The hotel's website says that the nearest Metro stop is Ulubatli which is 200m from the hotel. Read into this but it's 200m 'as the crow flies'. If you decide to get to the hotel this way, walk out of the metro station and walk straight down to the sets of traffic lights halfway down the road. Cross over and walk up the road and when you get to the 'spilt' in the road, take the right fork and walk up the hill to the square where the big turkish flag is located. Turn left at the roundabout and walk down to the next set of lights where you will see the tram stop and the Holiday Inn in front of you. Look right and you'll see the hotel. We stayed in a 'premium room' which was very clean and spacious. The spa area was very good but if you want to go swimming make sure you take a swimming hat or you'll have to buy one for 5TL. We decided not to have breakfast as it is expensive at 15 Euros per person per day and we also did not eat dinner at the hotel as we found it offered a limited selection but did offer a buffet. I would suggest eating in the local areas, however we could only find 'kebab style' resturants with small eating areas in them close to the hotel. My recommendations would be to go to the area of Sultanahmet on the tram where you can eat both local cuisine and more 'western style' cuisine as well. The side streets near to the Basilica Cistern offer reasonable prices and good cuisine. The hotel is away from the touristic area but the tram is close and cheap to travel on at 2TL per 'jeton'. I would recommend this hotel to anyone but be prepared to travel to the touristic areas about 10-15 minutes on the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for us”
Reviews.Author: Sparklyfeet
Reviews.Content: We liked the big room and the spa in the basement. Take your swimming gear and swim hat. Breakfast was too expensive so we ate at the baker/cafe nearby which was good value and friendly. Bar for beer nearby also. We appreciated being away from the tourist area and loved the regular tram trips for people watching and exchanging observations afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: Aadilshah
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay in this hotel. The rooms are a good size with all the facilities. The cleanliness of the hotel is excellent and the cleaners spend lots of time to make sure rooms are upto the mark. The reception staff are very friendly and with try their best to sort out any query for you. There is free wifi which is always helpful. The tram station is next to the hotel which is the cheapest mode of transport to move around. The pool facilities are excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Bit out of the way. Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: RobbleLondon
Reviews.Content: Rather than rave or rant about a hotel I'll buck this trend and give the Barcelo Eresin a resounding 3 out of 5. It's fine. The room is pretty good in an it-could-be-anywhere marble bathroom way and it has an ok pool. The obvious downside to this hotel is the thing that they can't change: it's a little bit out of the way. But, as everyone says, the tram stops right outside the hotel and goes to all the useful places: - Beyaziy for The Grand Bazaar - Sultanhamet for the sights (15 mins) - Eminonu for Boshphorus cruises - Over Galata bridge to Karajoy (25 mins) for all the restaurants, rooftop bars etc. in Beyoglu. The tram is dead easy to use and less than a Â£1 / â‚¬1.20 a journey. I was pretty happy with this hotel because I got it for a good rate on Hotwire on Easter weekend (and got breakfast elsewhere instead of paying 15 Euros a head for a hotel buffet). The location was most annoying when I wanted to go back to my hotel and relax a bit (there's NOTHING nearby). It's also a long Â£45 / â‚¬50 taxi ride to Sabiha Gokcen airport which is where Easyjet flies into (factor that faff and cost in if you book a budget flight). Get a metered taxi from the hotel and airport - don't pay the hotel's markup for a transfer. If I came again I'd stay in Beygolu - it's better to be near the restaurants and bars than the sights really. If money was no object I'd stay at Witt Istanbul suites (twice the price of the Erecin) but I don't think I could've done better for this price range. PS the WIFI didn't work in my room. PPS go to Muzedechanga for a nice but not too extravagantly-priced dinner if you can. Even though it's a Â£15 / â‚¬18 taxi ride or a tram trip to Kabatas then a long (on Saturday night anyway) bus journey on the 22 to Sakip Sabanci Museum (buy a bus card from a news vendor).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: msq123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelo Eresin Topkapi for 2 days. The hotel is very conveniently located close to a tram station which takes you to touristy Sultanahment area in under 15 mins. The hotel offered great service and comfort at very reasonable price. We highly recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the centre, but very good position”
Reviews.Author: biancaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the centre but there is an excellent tram, that stops right in the front. The ticket is less than 1 euro and it takes you directly to the most popoular attractions (gran bazar, Topkapi Palace, St Sofia etc) in 7-10 stops. The tram (called metro bus) passes every few minutes. Position is therefore the best aspect of the hotel. Rooms are nice (I was in the deluxe) and I reserved with a special offer, but otherwise it was 325 euro and it's not worth that money. Particoularly because the room was very noisy: you could here everything from the corridory and the presence of lots of children did not help in that sense. Elevator was an other weak point: the 3 elevator were constantly occupied and you had to wait a lot. I had dinner in the restaurant and it was ok, nothing special. The wellness centre was nice and relaxing even if the showers were all quite dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: VTgirlKent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the city but has the beauty of being directly outside a bus stop and also a tram stop. Beautiful interior. The rooms are of excellent size and air con works well. Good bathrooms with good products. The staff are friendly and eager to please. The drinks are very over priced but it is a 5 star hotel so what do you expect? We ate here on the last night and I must say the food was excellent. We ate A la carte as we did not fancy the buffet and there was so much food on our plates that I could not finish it all. We would definitely stay here again when visiting this wonderful city. There are bars and restaurants about 10 minutes walk away which are obviously cheaper than the actual city centre. We ate near the hotel once and it was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Oldstyle_53
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business, which is just outside of Istanbul. Clean & comfortable, friendly staff. The big advantage is the easy to use tram, which is right outside the front door. There is no need to drive in Istanbul. I've tried driving here and believe me, it's not fun. The tram is 10 to 15 minutes from all the historical sights and costs only 2 TL, about $1. The hotel serves a decent buffet breakfast and changes it regularly. They even have a "healthy" section of low fat, low carb options. Something you should consider if you eat dinner at the traditional Turkish restaurants. Free WiFi is another plus. Only negative is that the neighborhood is kind of run down. Safe, but the crumbling sidewalks make it hard to power walk in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable, Good Location but not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Yerevan75
Reviews.Content: On the lastminute.com website this hotel claims to be the cheapest 5 star hotel in Istanbul. That is probably true at 70 Euros/Night but the hotel does not deserve 5 stars - it is a good 4 star hotel. Pros: - - Comfortable Rooms with large TV Screens and very fast free WiFi connection - - Location: Instead of taking an expensive Taxi from/to the airport, you can just catch the metro that leaves directly from the airport terminal and will set you back only 4 Turkish Liras (~$2.50). The metro takes you to Zeytinburnu where you change the line and get to Topkapi. The journey from the airport takes around 30 minutes. The hotel is located only 200 meters from Topkapi Station and it is a large yellow building but it is hidden as it is down the main road. Simply cross the two narrow side roads that merge with the main road and get on the pavement by the main road and you will see it. Although not in the historical center of Istanbul, you can get to the center with the metro in 12-15 minutes and it is a much quieter location that Taksim/Sultanahmet... - - Excellent Restaurant. We had lunch and dinner during our stay and were very pleased with the food. The wine was overpriced so we stuck with the food that was plentiful and very good quality. Cons: - - There are no shops around the hotel and they don't even provide free water - - Mini Bar is limited and pricey Overall, a good choice at 70-90 Euros a night but I wouldn't pay more than that...

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gregntrees
Reviews.Content: Its another hotel in Istanbul, frankly your website presentation was excellent but gave too high expectation before the arrival. Of course during the stay everything good. A small note about the lift, they look old and dirty, I believe by cleaning more the lift will give a much more better impression to the whole facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: MJWakim
Reviews.Content: - spacious rooms - my daughter loved the on site hair stylist - I liked the excercise facilities - they sent an urgent fax to California for me and didn't charge me (unlike previous hotels I've stayed at) - free Internet service had decent speed

Reviews.Title: “My Stay At Barcelo Eresin”
Reviews.Author: Hypion
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel last week. Good location, friendly staff. Easy to reach Sultan Ahmet historic area by tram right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: yasseerr
Reviews.Content: i was there 22-25 /12 / 2011 i had large room 4 beds for me and my family ,very good hotel very near to tram(pazarteke station) that you can go any where withen few minuts nice breakfast , service , sure ill be there again...............

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in the old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: marc d
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in the historical part of Istanbul (15mn by taxi to the blue Mosquee) there is a tramway near with direct line to the touristic center. elegant large rooms "deluxe" with nevertherless small bathroom with toilets not separated. Normal services for a local 5 stars hotel : restaurant, room service, mini bar and also an inside swimming pool, sauna , hammam, turckish bath, jaccuzzi etc.. the staff is helpfull and smily, there are some restaurants at about 800m very goog and cheap (like Altinkapi restaurant..12 euros/pers with non alcoolic drinks). Location a little far from the center it's impossible by walk.

Reviews.Title: “bercelo eresin topkapi”
Reviews.Author: abdullah e
Reviews.Content: wonderfull hotel, very good service and good connexxion with the bus and subway

Reviews.Title: “Close to tramway.”
Reviews.Author: ovallejo13
Reviews.Content: Normal hotel, clean, attentive staff, average restaurant, bar. Didn't see Turkish bath / spa, so can't rate that. Very close to Patakkale Tramway station.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nomad59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October 2011, at the beginning of a tour of Turkey. The staff were very helpful and pleasant, the food in the restaurant and bar was good. We had a quiet room down the side of the hotel, which was quite large, with a seating area. The tram into the main tourist areas stops outside the hotel. Istanbul is a great city, which is probably just as well because unfortunately my husband developed flu so we had to stay at the hotel while the tour went on its way. It was easy for me to do lots of sightseeing on my own - I never felt unsafe. The Front Office Manager (Safi Aysu) was really helpful to me. Organised the doctor and made sure we could continue to stay in the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel but away from the sights”
Reviews.Author: DW16
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as we got a good deal on lastminute.com and so we were very pleased with the price and we received an upgarde too. Staff we very pleasant and helpful and the facilites were excellent. The only issue is that it is a 30/40 minute walk to most of the tourist sights like the blue mosque, however, there is a tram stop immediately outside which is great. If staying at the hotel ask for a room facing away from the road as it gets a bit noisy if you have the window open which you probably will need as the rooms are hot.

Reviews.Title: “Just proves that loyalty pays off”
Reviews.Author: BruceHunter
Reviews.Content: Not sure bow many times I've stayed here in the course of two years - lots probably ! Excellent hotel, great facilities and a wonderful welcome on my arrival Room rates quite high right now - Istanbul is a busy busy place Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Visit”
Reviews.Author: kerrydeare
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eresin from 07 to 13 Nov 2011. Our visit was quite fine, thanks to the fine service and hospitality shown us by all staff and management, in particular Assistant General Manager Sonia. We would heartily recommend this hotel when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We got the best treatment.”
Reviews.Author: Rao1940497
Reviews.Content: With my wife, I stayed in this hotel from Nov 7 to 12, 2011. The check-in was very swift, took just few seconds, room quite spacious, with good house keeping, reasonably wide choice of breakfast menu, co-operating and well behaved staff, with equally fast check-out. The free internet open all 24x7, with laptops in business centre lobby is an add-on. We are quite satisfied with the total services offered and we got a similar feel from other guests with whom we interacted, who had no complaints whatsoever. Infact a couple from US (Mrs Sonia & her hubby) were all praise for Ms Sonia, a senior executive of the hotel who assisted them well during their stay. Not to be left out is the location of the hotel, which is not in a crowded place, but with a tram stop just opposite the hotel; besides a Carrefour outlet nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Barcelo”
Reviews.Author: Nishamr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelo in Nov. first week. The hotel was good and so was the service. We enjoyed the spa n indoor heated pool facilities. The staff were courteous n helpful.Location wise it is a quiet neighbourhood. Plus point is the easy access to the metro station.Breakfast variety is nice n healthy. Our kids had a great time at the pool. There is Carrefour express right next to the hotel n also some good restaurants down the street.Would definately stay here for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Three star perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Igor G
Reviews.Content: I say no for the five star... thou for a 3+ star hotel it is very-very good, and is easily accessible by car.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay with Barcelo”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: We've recently returned from a stay mid-October in Istanbul at the Barcelo Eresin. Our entire stay was very nice and we will return to this property. The Club Premium rooms are very spacious and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was delicious with great variety each morning. There was easy access to the metro station in front of the hotel which took you to all locations in the city with ease for 2 Lira each way. The hotel was all we expected and more and Barcelo we will see you on our next visit to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann V
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for making your citytrip a pleasure. After a whole day of visiting, you can enjoy the big, heated inside swimmingpool or the jacuzi or sauna all included. It would have been better if we knew in advance that swimming caps are obligatory, but for only 5 TL we could buy some. At our arrival we received a free massage voucher for 20 minutes per person. And it was fantastic. The rooms are big, nice and clean, a bit short of closets but that's a minor problem. The hotel is situated outside the old town, but trams are riding every 2 minutes and just in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all aspects, except one!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth1960_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. After looking at nearly every hotel in Istanbul, we finally decided on the Barcelo Eresin. We were hesitant because of certain reviews about the distance from the city centre. This is total rubbish. It is a 15 minute tram ride and the tram is literally at the front door. The room was Club Prestige and was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The breakfast buffet was huge and had something for every nationality. The choices were amazing - six kinds of juice alone. The hotel reception staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke excellent English. Many people in Turkey do not understand English so be prepared. Don't bother doing expensive tours in Istanbul, you can do everything by public transport for 2TL per trip. The tram takes you to every tourist site. Yes, it is crowded, but so is the metro in Paris and the tube in London. The free massage was a plus, as was the pool and the jacuzzi, but we didn't really have time to use them. There a lot of little places to eat near the hotel. On the last night we discovered Iskender, on the Holiday Inn side walking towards the city. Had a great meal for 30TL for two and were the only tourists. The trip by taxi from the airport costs 35 TL. While in Istanbul we visited Barcelo Saray and Doubletree Hilton and were NOT impressed. The negatives: the hotel rooms are not at all sound proofed and you can hear everything that happens in the next room: the toilet, shower, TV, people talking etc.You can hear people banging doors and talking loudly in the corridor. This seemed to go on most of the night ans start agin early in the morning. We got very little quality sleep at this hotel which was disappointing. It shocked us as we have travelled the world and never had this problem in a hotel of this calibre. I want to return to Istanbul soon, but would hesitate to stay here for the noise factor. After walking Istanbul all day you need sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Finally -- a hotel that lives up to it's 5 star billing”
Reviews.Author: pilipili
Reviews.Content: After some medioce and one truly horrible so called 5 star hotel on Bora's Cultural Tour this place is everything it says it is. Great location --- the tram station just across the road makes it a piece of cake to get anywhere in Istanbul. Service is excellent as are the clean well appointed rooms. We did not have dinner at this place ( unlike the sister hotel in Ankara ) and thus cannot objectively comment on this. Breakfast items expansive and of good quality and freshness. This place was a welcome relief for all of us on this tour.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite five star”
Reviews.Author: Dencal1945
Reviews.Content: Although rated 5 star it is unlikely it would exceed 4. There is an air of "needs refreshing" about the whole hotel, whilst quite presentable it could be a whole lot better particularly given the prices charged for what are quite simply rooms. We found service lacking just a bit particularly after we were stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes between floors when there had been a very audible metal tearing and breakage. Only received one comment over the emmergency phone that "we know about it" and reception all but dismissed our comments the next morning when we raised the subject. We will admit that the breakfast supplied was fresh but even then there was not a great deal to choose from. I too found it a long way from where the tourists sights were in Sultanahmet, and although it was suggested we could take the tram which runs at the front of the hotel we were not prepared to be crammed in lioke sardines as with the passengers in the tram.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place”
Reviews.Author: LouHarrison
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo was a very nice hotel, great service, good location

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: paoloTaormina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very far from the main touristy area. The rooms are decent but the staff don't speak very good English. Even though the hotel sits right by a tram stop, the tram is always congested and very very very smelly. I highly recommend you steer clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good transport links to all major sights”
Reviews.Author: Ubaidur
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from staying at this hotel and we thought it was clean and airy. Very good links to inner city and hotel location was very good, just outside sultanhamet but close enough to take tram into city, good shops, bars and restaurants within walking distance from hotel

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte R
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a lovely week in Istanbul. We agreed with other reviewers that this is not a 5 star hotel, but we felt we'd got a good deal so it was value for money for us. Although it is a long walk from the hotel to the main sights, the tram across the road is great and a cheap way of getting into town quite quickly. It's also a cheap and efficient way of getting to the airport (4tl per person). The pool and jacuzzi were nice and usually not at all crowded - a relaxing way to start or finish the day. The free wifi was very useful. We didn't bother with the â‚¬17 breakfast - far cheaper alternatives available in town. We'd also recommend avoiding the bar: the most expensive of anywhere we went in Istanbul (which wasn't a surprise) but poor, slow service as well, which you shouldn't get when paying that much. All the other staff in the hotel were efficient and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Toastie72
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is not a 5 star hotel as advertised by certain websites. However, it was good value for money although didn't include breakfast which could have been purchased for â‚¬17 pp per day which is a bit pricey. Better heading into town and experiencing the local cafes. Room was spaceious, clean and very comfortable. A bit noisy from traffic on main road but was fine. Staff very friendly. Facilities were excellent and great to relax after a long day touring the city. The hotel is a little far out of the old city centre with nothing much around the hotel. However, it is serviced by a regular tram every few minutes although this is always very packed. It is great location for airport costing on average TL30 for taxi. Overall, great hotel but pity it not closer to the old city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Perhentians
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Barcelo Eresin. We stayed three nights and would most definetely come back due to the price. The tram stop is literally in front of the hotel and a 15 minute journey into the centre. We had a lot of interaction with the staff and at all times they were very helpful. The free wifi was impressive, you go to hotels and the connection is bad. I had a very good connection at all times, in the room and by the pool. The facilities are impressive likewise, the swimming pool was a good size, the Turkish bath is nice and well kept. I had a sports massage whilst there which was impressive, not the best I have had but was very good. Overall a convenient hotel, only 30-35 tl to airport back and forth. Tram ride cost 2tl for each journey. Rooms were clean, breakfast was adequate. It has something for everyone, not the best breakfast buffett I have seen but it does the job, not going to berudge them against that. I will be back on my next trip to Istanbul. Although listed as a 5 star, I would say 4 star personally. All in all an excellent stay, very good place to set up camp for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Thought better service”
Reviews.Author: redarrow83
Reviews.Content: The best room was suite , at least should be excelent service. -Check in didnt take time which is good. -No body came to show us the room at least . -Ordered Iron and table , takes 1 hr to get . - There was no Complementry Water in the room when i ordered didnt get it:) ( as they said and as a 5/4 stars hotel should have complementryn water) Note: these is the second day for me and there is 3 more days more . Will update u soon -

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and quality with first class access to the city and airport”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week here staying in a 'triple' room with two teenage children. We each had a hugely positive value of an unpretentious hotel which delighted in every way - bar one. We had a disappointing breakfast on day one - and didnt try there again. Disappointing because this is the easiest city in the world to enjoy a fresh and tast Mediterranean breakfast with consumate ease - at significantly less expense than the hotel. But this was a minor niggle in a stay which really delivered in every other way. Dont overlook the huge advantage of the tram stop 100m away. For the princely sum of TL200 this will whisk you right down to Eminonu in under 30 minutes - every time. It also cross- connects to the airport pretty efficeienty and reliably too. The Theodossin Walls are all of 200m away from the hotel away from the city and easily overlooked. We booked on air miles through BA and paid Â£550 for all for 5 night - which felt like a real bargain. We would unhesitatingly recommend it and would return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again -- clean- great location”
Reviews.Author: BN5288
Reviews.Content: Hello, I visited Istanbul with my wife and decided to stay in this hotel for 8 nights, I really found great welcoming and fast reaction with all requests. I was given the choice between smoking and non smoking rooms, the breakfast was great and having many many choices and I really liked it, a polite girl always coming to us on the breakfast table and asks for our preferable drinks with a great smiling, I really respected this. The location of the hotel is great and you can directly either ride a taxi from the gate (It is expensive so I donâ€™t advise) or you can ride the train 20 meters in front of hotel and go easily to your destination in the area. Swimming pool is wonderful and not rush, only five to six people at that time was swimming which is great to feel that you own this pool. Cleaning the room was done regularly depending on my request and as per my tours program and the girl who was cleaning the room was polite and hard worker. The Bathroom is shining with a good smell, room was clean and great. Unfortunately, I cant saty in this hotel this year because this hotel is not listed in the list of hotels that the tourism company in Jordan works with, but definitely I will not miss any chance to stay in Barcelo Hotrel if I found any tourism company in Jordan listing it. Thanks for all the team who works in Barcelo. Regards, M.Marei

Reviews.Title: “very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Sultana B
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at Barcelo, istanbul in August 2011 for 4 nights. The hotel was clean, close to the main tourist areas of istanbul (sultanamet) but far enough to take you away from the noise and hassle of this area (one 10 minute tram ride, 2TL adult one way, takes you into the main areas for eating, shopping and sightseeing) - taking the tram is an adventure in itself- needs to be experienced! not for the faint hearted, great fun. During our stay we had a problem with the plumbing for the toilet in our hotel room. once reported this problem was dealt with the upmost professionalism and speed. Sonia Guisado (assistant general manager) could not be more helpful. customer service was above and beyond what we could have asked for, when dealing with this problem. not only did she oversee the brisk completion of this probelm, we were given a free breakfast, upgraded to VIP facilities, offered a massage and given direct contact details for the assistant manager to deal with any issues we had, thereafter. Sonia and her team are a credit to the hotel maintaining a 5 star service for all their customers. I would highly recommned a stay at this hotel, if you are seeking a stylish and clean room, excellent customer service and staying at a place close to the main tourist area, but far enough to take you away from the hussle and noise of the area. main problems with this hotel are, a room at the front you need to deal with the busy road, a room at the back you need to deal with another building, brick wall too close for my comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but NOT a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: blueroose
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I've stayed at 3, 4, and 5 star hotels. I've been to Istanbul 5 times and have always said the Turks are among the nicest people in the world - that's why I keep coming back! First, this is NOT a 5 star hotel and I feel jipped by lastminute.com. They need to re-categorize this hotel to a 4-star max. The day before my arrival, I called to ask for early check-in. I was told about the 45 euro charge but was told that since I was fasting, they would check me in early at no charge. When i went to check in, I was treated like a criminal! The man spent the entire 20 minutes trying to find out if the person I spoke to really was working the day before. After total silence for several minutes of investigating, he handed me my card key without a word then rudely told me he would be reprimanding the person who promised to waive the 45 euros but that he's given me a room anyway and will waive it. I had to locate the elevators myself. The Room I was given a room with two twin beds with a view of the parking lot. All i can say is I have never in my life, even in personal bathrooms, have I seen such a destroyed bathtub. The plaster was peeling badly in 2 locations, whereby if you stepped on it, you would seriously cut yourself. The toilet seat cover was yellow. At first I thought it was an odd color with a backdrop of a white porcelain toilet, but realized it was stained yellow. GROSS. Given I flew in on a red-eye, I desperately needed sleep before a meeting. But after 3 hours of tossing and turning, I could not sleep. The AC was broken and I was hot. I finally couldn't put up with it and called and asked for another room. Thank God, this time it was a gracious receptionist and she moved me to a better room. But after moving to the new room, I realized the guy who checked me in didn't return my passport so I called. He insisted he gave it to me and they asked me to return to my old room to look for it. I went and when I returned they called to say they found it at the front desk. I was not only sleep-deprived, I was hot and sweaty at this point. Upon my check out, the issue of the 45 euros came up again! I was told that they called lastminute.com and confirmed it was disclosed on their website and therefore they needed to charge me! I was appalled at the time they spent investigating this issue. Of course, I argued that I was told it was waived TWICE now and I refused to pay. Other Cons -Amenities are CHEAP. You can't even use the bath cap without ripping it. Tissues are like cardboard. Soap/Shampoo is like detergent. No robe. Cheap paper slippers. -Cheap linens. - The bathroom counters, floors and bathub all had water stains, especially the counter and floors. Felt dirty. -They have no respect for the "Do Not Disturb Sign" -They charge 44 TL (~$32) for a really simple breakfast buffet with no omlette bar or anything special. Again, was treated like a criminal, as they reminded me 3 times that there is an extra charge for breakfast. I never returned. -Location: not convenient to anything. -Hair "salon": It was nothing more than a run-down barber and the woman there tried ripping me off by quoting me 50 TL for a simple blow out. The going rate is 5-10TL. Maybe 20 in fine hotel salons. The thing is, the woman working at the spa witnessed this and said nothing but her face said it all. PROS -Free wireless -Computers in business center -Tram in front of hotel -Mostly polite staff -Good massages

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: robertraymond
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good place, in front of a tramway stop and it is very easy to reach from the Ataturk airport. The historical center is 20 - 25 minutes far from the hotel, using the tram. Rooms are confortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way below average”
Reviews.Author: LauraClare
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour we were on. We stayed at the hotel on two separate occasions for 2-3 nights each. First of all the hotel is too far from the center of town. A taxi ride to old district will run you around 20 TL. Yes itâ€™s right across the street from the tram but I rode the tram once in Istanbul and that was enough. Good luck getting on and off the tram any time of day. Second the quality of the rooms, restaurant and lobby are below average. Also we were on a non-smoking floor but we smelled smoke in the hallways and our room. One of our travel companions asked for a smoking room and was told by the reception desk that he could smoke in his non-smoking room (which would explain the why the non-smoking floors smelled like an ashtray). Also the air conditioners didn't work well so the rooms got very warm and stuffy. The hotel caters to multiple nationalities which is great. They have a large population of Iranian and Saudi guests. So there was a large population of women in full Islamic clothes in the lobby and at the restaurant during breakfast. I couldn't help feeling underdressed in my capri pants and short sleeve tops.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Flower5067
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barcelo Eresin hotel for 7 nights ( 14- 22 July 2011) with my family. everythingâ€™s was so nice, the room was so clean and they arranged a bed for my 5 years old kid free of charge. They gave me a Kittle to boiling water for tea and coffee freely and it was so good. The location of hotel is so nice and far from noisy place and only 15 minutes to center of tourist places with Tram but i suggest you go to the sultanahmet by walking. it approximately take one hour time from hotel , we did 4 time and enjoyed the walking ( this good for loosing weight or not to gain weight because of Turkish food!). The staff of the hotel are so kind and lots of them can speak English and they are so kind and polite. The pool and spas are very useful . The breakfast was so nice . some times housekeeping staff forgot to complete their job but if you call room service they do immediately Totally everything was good. Thank you very much Barcelo eresin Topkapi hotel

Reviews.Title: “one of our Best stays in an excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bossman1944
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Barcelo Eresin Topkapi for about 8days and enjoyed every minute. The Location is in a serene enviornment of Topkapi. The main shopping ad Historical sites are at a close distance . The transportation is available 24hours.They even have a Tram station right opposite the hotel which is extremely user friendly and the Tram service is excellent. we suggest try to use the tram to the maximum as it affords a very economical and efficient mode of travel. The staff of the Hotel is very very friendly and the service is par excellace. we intend visiting the hotel again in the next holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not 5 star quality”
Reviews.Author: Fariba2011
Reviews.Content: The rooms desperately need refurbishment. Bath tubs and sinks are grimy and unclean (need a good scrubbing) The mini bar and the hotel's bar are over priced. The rooms are quite clean, bedding is good and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Room service is good. Housekeeping is also good. We stayed in this hotel on our second honeymoon for 5 days. The hotel is too far from the city centre. I recommend if you are going to Istanbul for sight seeing, stay at the hotels in Sultanahmet area. The trams are usable, but at times are so full there's no escape from sweaty armpits in your face. Better to get a taxi. Taxis are cheap and on meter BUT make sure you don't get conned by dodgy taxi drivers quoting fixed fares. On checkout, make sure you check your bills thouroughly as they charged us for mini bar that we had not used. Overall I would say I had a good time in Istanbul, loved the grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque, but next time I go to Istanbul I will stay in the Best Western Premier Hotel in Sultanahmet (www.thehomesuites.com) It is cheaper and it is really a 5 star hotel with an amazing view of the sea and a very lovely rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Client is the center of attention. Great”
Reviews.Author: MyTripScreen
Reviews.Content: Charming welcome, Charming Hotel, Staff very professional, very good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zulu_in_uae
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the room, large flat screen TV, and free Wifi. Service was excellent. Location is great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,Great staff, in a quiet part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Linda&John
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before our tour of Turkey and 3 nights after our return. Very enjoyable stay. Rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. Check in was a simple matter; we were in our room quickly and ready to explore Istanbul. There is only one restaurant and one very small Bar/Grill in the hotel.. Our breakfasts were included with a large variety of food, but was very hectic and unorganized for a "tour" hotel where you need to be on the bus at a specific time.. We never ate dinner at the hotel; usually taking the tram into Sultanahmet where there are tons of restaurants, shops, and sightseeing! The hotel is quite a distance from the historic area, but the tram is located directly across the street and it's a simple matter to buy a token for 1.75TL (each way) and ride about 15 minutes into the center of the action. The station across from the hotel is Pazartekke and it's about 7 stops to the Grand Bazaar and 9 stops to Sultanahmet where the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia are located. All stops are announced, and there's a map inside the tram to keep track of the stops. The trams are very efficient and clean, but always very crowded, especially during rush hours. The reception staff at the hotel are very pleasant, efficient and always willing to help, be it directions, or recommendations for tours or restaurants. The amenities at the hotel were quite adequate, especially the use of an umbrella which could have come in handy.. Bring facecloths from home as you'll not see one in any hotels in Turkey. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Turkey and would definitely stay at the Barcelo Eresin Topkapi in the future. Happy to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, Not quite as good as other Barcelo's”
Reviews.Author: TonyGNCFC
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Istanbul is located close to the main tram line which is very handy for getting into the old town where the big ticket sights such as the Blue Mosque, Haggia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and Royal Palaces stand. The staff speak English and are friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and had a decent sized, comfortable bed. A couple of minor niggles with the room, firstly the safe was practically on the floor which made access difficult and secondly the shower was very low pressure and let down an otherwise decent bathroom. Breakfast was of good quality although obviously lacking in bacon and other pork products due to local sensibilities. You could not complain about the variety or quality of food provided. The spa facilities were nice but nothing special. Pool a standard 10m size with a strange rule that even bald men such as myself have to wear swimming caps when swimming! The spa also has a good sauna and turkish bath and a moderate steam bath (it never seemed to get to a sufficiently high temperature). The gym is huge and very well equipped. Couples should note that after 5pm the main sauna is men only. The hotel is quite near a minaret and we were awoken by the 5am call to prayer on a couple of occassions so ear-plugs may be in order if you are a light sleeper. Overall a good hotel but just lacking the polish, style and quality of other Barcelo hotels I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: howardtravels1304
Reviews.Content: clean, good food, friendly staff close to the historIcal places suggest hotel shoud provide coffee and Tea making facility in the rooms , if get up early am use ful to get going after coffee !!! most of the 4* hotels around the world do provide but barcelo Topkapi does not !!. At the check out desk helpful 2 ladies Senem& Sonia very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lxcleary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights before going on a tour of Turkey and Egypt. We had a well appointed room. Noting some other comments, we found our room to be very quiet.. Staff were very helpful ... we were particularly impressed by the courteous and very professional service provided by Bayram in the B Lounge where we ate our evening meals on three occasions.

Reviews.Title: “PÄ°CASSO RESTAURANT”
Reviews.Author: anitanelson
Reviews.Content: I was stay Barcelo hotel Turkey Ä°stabul .It was so enjoy time , all hotel ' s staff so kind. We loved turkish breakfast and I woud like to say thank u to Suleyman from Piccaso restaurant he s so younger but so kind .he take order correct.Thank you very much Suleyman evreting. I would like to say something from houskeeping they don' t know english. When I called them they don t understand me pls u r 5 star hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Weekend”
Reviews.Author: t0wer_bridge
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner had a lovely weekend in this hotel. It was our first time in Ä°stanbul and staff were very friendly and helpful.Tram is right at the front of the hotel and runs very frequently.I recommend you to take one of the many massages offered in the SPA.

Reviews.Title: “good location ... good spa”
Reviews.Author: TheMichaels
Reviews.Content: The location was good - only 10 minutes to the Blue Mosque with the tram just outside the hotel. Istanbul is a great city to navigate around. (+) points - good spa, good location for tram, breakfast had a lot to choose from, room was large (we had a premium room), good fast WIFI in the rooms and dinning room (-) points - room was at the front and was quite noisy, the conceirge tried to push a restaurant on us on the first night (the restaurant was expensive), dont fall for it there is such a choice - just get on a tram to towards the Blue Mosque, used the bar once as the staff were a bit miserable!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel a little bit distant to the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Amano
Reviews.Content: (+) Barcelo Eresin Topcapi is really comfortable. 1. Spa and gym in the hotel basement allow you to rest after the whole day of sightseeing. 2. Restaurant serves very nice (but a little monotony) breakfasts. 3. Hotel staff is very helpfully. 4. Free Wi-Fi signal is really strong and you can use your laptop w/o any troubles. (-) Serious issue: 1. Getting to/from the old city in the rush hours can take even more than half hour. Regardless if you use taxi (traffic jam) or tram (5-7 stations to the old city). Trivia/peanuts: 2. i haven't noticed good restaurants around hotel. You have either to stay in hotel restaurant or go to the old city. 3. There are no shelves in the room and you have to hang all your clothes. As a result hangers often drop down. 4. In 5* hotel I would expect iro and ironing board in hotel room (as they have in Stambul in Sheraton Maslak or Hilton).

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about 5 Star !!”
Reviews.Author: meellis_7
Reviews.Content: Admittedly we left it too late in booking our hotel, so we knew location was going to be a challenge, putting that aside, whilst the lobby area, and rooms where stunning and the night staff team where great when they made rooms available for us at 5am for a very reasonable fee, it all went downhill very quickly. Housekeeping was a bit slap dash, no towels & general cleanliness was not great, also, wasn't sure if we were meant to bathrobes/ dressing gowns for our rooms either way wasn't there.... Whilst you don't go on holiday to watch tv abroad, the option of relaxing in your room watching a bit of tv wasn't possible- other than BBC News, Sky News (I think) & Cartoon Network, only 1 english speaking channel and no movie on demand channels - come on guys!! Tip - eat out as much as possible, whilst there was a large and colourful breakfast buffet selection (we didn't get past breakfast) - no flavour!! Noise really travels in this hotel - unfortunately for us our room was above the banqueting area, and for most of our stay we could we here the music until 2am. I suppose for us, the icing on the cake for this hotel experience is that they charge you a daily rate to have tea/ coffee facilities in your room. Personally I would really would query how this hotel got a 5 star rating - they must have a special section for the hotel inspectors/ reviewers or they got their rating off the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid room”
Reviews.Author: Drackar
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant, calm and well communicated hotel. Excellent service and attention. Splendid room (junior suite). After all day crossing the city spa is the ideal complement to relax and to prepare for a good dinner and a new day.

Reviews.Title: “It's the front desk service which sets this hotel apart”
Reviews.Author: BruceHunter
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed here several times and now have "VIP" service all the way I was on a longer rtip, with a lot of entertainment / travel / reservations to sort out. Apart from giving me an exceptional welcome, the team were exceptional, and made my stay in Istanbull so much the better. Excellent service - and the Turkish Baths a re exceptional

Reviews.Title: “Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: LouiseB2010
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review of a hotel before. But I'm so disappointed by the noise level in this 5 star hotel. I didn't sleep at all last night ahead of a 5am airport collection because of the noise levels. Not for the first time on our five night stay loud dance music from a wedding or other celebration in the hotel could be clearly heard on our fourth floor bedroom. By the time the music stopped at 4am the screaming and shouting of guests kept us up even longer. It's an expensive hotel twenty minutes from the old city. I think there are better locations and quieter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: NAMAGUI
Reviews.Content: Istambul city is an amazing place. One of the cities that I recommend visit. The hotel has a good location and the staff is great. I recommend the experience in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay and welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: aadam23
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly and welcoming staff, clean room. I would like to thank expecially to Ms Feysa who help us at the check in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew0
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is quite a long way from the main tourist centre, however the tram system is very good. Standing room only quite often. The hotel is what you expect from a 5 star.. very good standard of rooms, we were upgraded to a premium room which was a good size with a great shower. Transport from the airport via taxi was about 25 lira Breakfast had a good choice, however the waiters were a bit slow with the tea and coffee

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: JanvdG
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay for a weekend in a Hotel in Istanbul. This decision was made out of the blue from foto's on the internet and some reactions from other visitors. After all it was a very comfortabel stay in this hotel with very friendly employees as all the Turkisch people we have met. The room was very good, but noisy. You have to keep the window open because of the high temperature in the room. There is no airconditioning. Because of this you meet the noise of the busy street. But we found this quite normal in a big city and had no problems with that. Advantage is the good rail-connection to downtown Istanbul. It is cheap and crowdy but very efficient to come everywhere within a short time. The food and coffee are very good in the bar and restaurant, as well as the overwhelming breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent service in a very good location.”
Reviews.Author: impi62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I had booked a junior suite but got a suite because the suite is very quiet, the junior suite supposedly louder. Unfortunately, the suite was very dark and the view was opposite to the house. Why you Clup the premium rooms are not on the 4th and 5th floor? On the home page of Barcelo, a limousine transfer from airport to hotel and back offered. That I had booked costs 65 â‚¬. Picked up but I was kind of a shuttle bus. Since I find the price of 65 â‚¬ too high. Otherwise, I found everything very nice and will definitely stay again at the Barcelo Topkapi Eresim because every year I get to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelo Hotel is my beloved Hotel when I visit Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: avitalyael
Reviews.Content: The reasons: 1. Very wellcoming stuff - speaking very good English. 2. Convenient rooms, allways clean. 3. Very good breakfast 4. The Health club is an additional pleasure. Only this time the wet sauna and Hammam were not warm enough.

Reviews.Title: “a bit faraway from the city itself, but in general rather ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evgenia_87
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit faraway from the city centre, you will need 15 minutes by tram to reach the historical part. The tram station is directly by the entrance, so in general you won't have any problems with transport. We had a room with an access to the roof, rather cute interior and not so very tiny like it could be in the old city. The stuff is rather ok and speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great spa, great service.”
Reviews.Author: DelTraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after a recommendation and we were not disappointed. The rooms were spacious clean and comfortable. The spa has a proper swimmimg pool with jaccuzi, sauna and steam room. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel was located a few hundred yards from a tram stop which is the perfect way to travel to the various sites in the old town as it is cheap (80p per trip) and frequent. While we were here we found a great restaurant just on tram stop down on the opposite side of the road called "AltinKapi" the food was good and the value was excellent. Some sites were disappointing the TopKapi Palace & Museum charge you to get in (Â£10) and then charge you more to enter particular rooms inside. Also the restaurant is very expensive a coffee costing 9 TL (Â£4.50).

Reviews.Title: “January in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tonypcol
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 found the Barcelo Topkapi Hotel very good. The booking with lastminute.com gave us flights and 3 nights for Â£150pp, so no grumbles there. Rooms were specious, comfortable, clean and close to each other. The bars and restaurant we didn't use because they are international not Turkish and the prices are silly money. The trams in to the city are inexpensive and very regular, clean and safe. We caught a cab back one night and it was inexpensive, but too be honest I'm struggling to remember too much about that night in general! The weather on our Satuday was great, sunny and a bit cold, Sunday a wash-out, but we saw thje sights, ate well and had a good time. Had to ask the hotel to sort out the aircon, which we wanted on in cooling mode, but they thought we wanted it hotter, so came back to an oven, but turned it down and opened the windows and we were fine. In fact our rooms were so quiet that even with the windows wide open it was easy to sleep as no street noise. The Barcelo Eresin Topkapi hotel was a very pleasant stay, oh and used their Spa, which is good too.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive but it is worthy”
Reviews.Author: SallyCao
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelo Eresin Topkapi from Dec 25 to Dec 28th, for a twin beds room. The breakfast is good, the room is clean and big, and the staff there are very helpful. Opposite the hotel, there is tram station. We took the tram to most of the places that we visited in Istanbul. It is not located in downtown but very quiet. Only about 15 minutes to the airport. There was an early check-in charge for USD30 a room as we arrived at 6:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in great location !”
Reviews.Author: merc_rr
Reviews.Content: Great location and all staff were VERY helpful! Wonderful health club and spa area. Had a friend join the 2 of us and they put an extra bed in with comfy bedding (bathrobe & slippers too)!â€�

Reviews.Title: “okay but no more than a 3 star by US standards”
Reviews.Author: shawnsk
Reviews.Content: cons: not a single drawer in any rooms. must hang your socks and underwear or lay them out on small work desk. bath and sink clean but smells of sewer when you run the water. coffee maker is extra for premium room. reserved king bed, got 2 beds next to each other, but one was 2 inches higher and kept spliting up during the night. battery operated in room safe had broken battery case. didn't open once and stopped working after. jacuzzi is worthless. steamroom is weak. sauna is separate for men and women. no A/C in Dec and we needed it. in winter they switch to heat only. free wireless internet does not work in room, only in lobby. pros: premium room size was good. room with jaccuzi is huge. breakfast is a good value. gym is good. pool is good. hamom is small but adequate. location is not bad. 20 TL to Taksim by taxi, 2 TL by bus, 2 TL to SultanAhmet by Tramway just across the street. friendly staff, but didn't do me any good for getting me my king bed. i paid $100/night plus 20 for breakfast for 2 which is okay. but i wouldn't pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: dmaginot
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nice rooms (junior suite), breakfast ok, restaurant so lala

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: 1st-sterling-homes
Reviews.Content: Third time that we have stayed at this location. Efficient and Attentive staff, from our arrival to our departure. The room had everything that we required. Free Wireless Internet. It was a bit warm for sleeping at night. Free English written "Turkish Daily Newspaper" delivered daily. The hotel has a swimming pool and Turkish bath. There is a permanent taxi service on hand day or night. We used the taxi to return to the airport about 20 minutes to Ataturk airport. The hotel is very close to the Pazartekke Tram stop, very useful for the tourist areas (Topkapi palace, Grand Bazarr, Eminonu ferry etc.). Pleasant relaxed atmosphere in the hotel and helpful staff. We booked through the Internet so paid less for our room. Wine was expensive in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: themaddies
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed this hotel enourmously the staff were friendly and helpful, the liesure facilities were super and very clean. I walked aroud the surrounding area and found it to be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: travelwithfamily79
Reviews.Content: hotel is good, food is good, staff a bit less friendly but location is good, We can visit the city by tram which has a station just opposite the hotel. A bit far from the centre of the city. I think their are lots of hotel available in the heart of the city where you can enjoy the nightlife ..

Reviews.Title: “A great choice - second time round”
Reviews.Author: BruceHunter
Reviews.Content: Again I opted to get a hotel car from the airport - great value and very comfortable - and seeing as my colleague's plance was an hour late - the driver very friendly and patient. The rooms are enormous, with balcony and the hotel first class Happy to reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Joseph310
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice, each time for 3 nights. We received a gracious welcome, an upgrade in our room and a sense of personal interest in our travel. Breakfast was included and was terrific. Great expresso!! The rail going into town is immediately across the street. Easy to use to come from the airport and return as well as to go into town. Great swimming pool, sauna, etc. An exceptional value for a 5 * hotel; less than many 4* hotels that we looked at. We can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty carpet,poor shower &too far from the action.”
Reviews.Author: Gordon037
Reviews.Content: 5* ?.The bedroom carpet was grubby in the area around the dresser and had lots of stains elsewhere. The air con only blew warm air as it was on a central system and there was nothing that could be done - so said the front desk and the guest relations young girl who we accidentally met on our departure.Hot water in the shower was a trickle so that the powewhen mixed with the cold was such that you had to wait to get wet. The hotel is right on the tram into Sultanahmet but the journey can take anything from 15 to 25 mins.Not too bad if you could find a seat but the trams were so full that on 2 occasions we got off and waited for the next rather than be subjected to other peoples breath. In accordance with it's5* status breakfast was 17.5 euros and pretty average - try Faro hotel in Sultanahmet where just as good for 11 Lira.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel feel with no drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Paulharvey56
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a three-day, four-night stay. The room looked spacious, clean and well fitted but felt stuffy. A few hours of air conditioning saw to that. From then on, the whole experience was as near perfect as we could have imagined. Great facilities, superb buffet breakfasts, helpful staff, room kept cleaned to the highest standards, and our one (buffet) dinner was as good as anything we had eating out - our six-year old was not charged, which also meant good value. What a place to come back to after a day's site seeing - pool and all. Tram into the old and new towns was cheap, fast, frequent, convenient and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, five star luxury”
Reviews.Author: MrsH007
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, would highly recommend it. We booked via last minute.com so the rooms were cheaper than normal. Nice sized family room - v v clean. Only slight grumble was it was a bit warm so we used the fan most of the time. The pool was fabulous - great for a 6 year old. Breakfast was awesome - so much choice and the marmalade is something else! Buffet dinner is good. Also nice local kebab shops in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Okay city hotel but single room was no bigger than a cupboard”
Reviews.Author: Yelsel10
Reviews.Content: As a single traveller I pay extra and was annoyed to be given a very small room with just a double bed, tiny fitted wardrobe and bench desk under the eaves. Nowhere to sit except on the bed and difficult to move round room.No chair on the very small balcony either and the room was stiflingly hot as air-con had been switched off as "it is winter" - it was 22 degrees and humid!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at very good location”
Reviews.Author: pulpo1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good place, in front of a tramway stop and it is very easy to reach from the Ataturk airport. The historical center is 20 - 25 minutes far from the hotel, using the tram. Rooms are confortable and clean. Hotel staff is very helpful and nice. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DebiSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barcelo Topkapi Eresin in Istanbul for three nights as part of a tour. Hotel was in a good location for public transport- tram located right outside the hotel running directly to Grand Bazaar and further to Blue Mosque etc. Just avoid peak hours- trams become very crowded! Rooms could have been a little larger- we were in a triple room. Bathroom quite small and shower not overly hot. Breakfast buffet quite good with all the usual Turkish foods plus pastries, fruit etc. Free internet which was good. Staff friendly and efficient except for the bar staff who could not speak English which we all found strange considering the hotel is catering for large tour groups! Two nice gift shops downstairs in the lobby which were reasonably priced for last minute souvenirs. There are local restaurants , supermarket and shops nearby within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Room and Hamam were very good.”
Reviews.Author: Satoma
Reviews.Content: There is one point of the improvement. I asked you to arrange a taxi from the airport when I reserved from web site. Since there was no response from your side, I confirmed the taxi reservation by E-mail but the communication was not smooth. I think it should be more systematic way to do this. Other points were very fine and I would like to stay once more if chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, outer location is made up for by lovely spa”
Reviews.Author: rncsta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to have a spa to relax in after sightseeing days, and it was a great choice. It is slightly further out of Istanbul but is only 10-15 minutes on the tram into the historic centre of Istanbul, and the tram stop is literally outside the hotel so very convenient. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which wasn't amazing quality (huge quantities and variety but nothing superb) but it was okay. There is a nice bar there for a drink/snacks. The spa was great, I had a lovely massage, and we used the pool and steam room most days. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for upscale stay - if you don't mind taking the tram!”
Reviews.Author: Adnamsbitter
Reviews.Content: This hotel merits its four-star rating. The rooms and amenities are excellent, the staff very helpful, and the restaurant is good, although quite pricey by Istanbul standards. The location is a bit out of the way, but there is a very good tram route with a stop close by which gets to the center of Istanbul in fifteen minutes or so (but it may be VERY crowded at rush hours!).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel excellent - location problematic”
Reviews.Author: lkuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early October. The hotel is large , well-equipped, full-service and has an excellent pool and spa suite. It is on the expensive side, although the 17 euro breakfast is well worth it. The room ( we were in premium) was large and comfortable , though a tea-making facility would have been a useful touch. The main drawback is the location. the hotel is just inside the city walls and a frequent tram that stops outside the hotel takes you the center of the old town in about fifteen minutes, But much of the time the tram is very crowded. We are used to the London Underground, but the Istanbul tram is Tokyo-crowded. It is quite unpleasant and a major consideration fro anyone staying.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: IES
Reviews.Content: What was good - the hotel, hotel staff, location, breakfast buffet, free wi-fi, fitness centre and an excellent business centre. Also the hotel is close to the main highway to the airport , so airport access is good. I used the hotel car pick-up both from the airport and to the airport and at EUR 50 it is great value and saves all the hassle with the Istanbul taxi drivers. The bad was the evening buffet, try and miss this. The hot food was barely warm and food seemed to lie around for a very long time, getting tougher as time went on. Pick from the a la carte menu, much better value and quality The ugly was the view from the room. I was on level A2 and looked onto some scrubland at window level, overlooked by some appartment blocks. Not a big deal if you are on business and rarely in the room, but not exactly old Istanbul. Would I go back, certainly, lots of positives that make up for some not so great items.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: shunp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Barcelo Eresin Topkapi hotel for 5 nights in September. The hotel facilities were excellent, reception staff and doorman were extremely friendly and helpful whenever we approcahed them. The hotel is conveniently located near a tram stop and is approximately 8 stops from the main tourist areas. Staying slightly out of town was preferable and quiter than in the main tourist areas. I highly recommend the Barcelo Eresin Topkapi if you intend staying in Istanbul. Istanbul is an amazing city. Shun and Donette Pillay (South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect for a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemma1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with friends on a city break. We chose the hotel as it had a spa and was close to a tram route and while there were good and bad points to the stay, I definitely wouldn't stay there again. On the plus side: 1. Check in was easy and at that time reception were friendly and although we arrived early, we only had to wait 10 minutes or so for our rooms. 2. Rooms were large, modern, comfortable and kept very clean. 3. My friends all used the spa and said it was nice. 4. The tram stop is literally outside the hotel making it easy to get into the city centre. 5. There was free wifi and Internet access. Unfortunately, for me, the negatives outweighed these positives: 1. Other than housekeeping and door staff who were great, others were not what you would expect at 5* hotel. Reception staff were unhelpful and unwilling to book restaurants - and when a number was engaged and we asked for another recommendation just told us to eat in their restaurant! Not very helpful, and the restaurant really doesn't compare with the nightlife over in Beyoglou, Sultanhammet etc where we had some great meals. Bar staff were very slow to serve, and didn't always bring what you had ordered - wrong drinks, toppings missing on pizza and ice cream etc. 2. The location isn't great even with the tram. There's a busy road and the tram running in front of the hotel and a very tired-looking residential block behind (my room looked out onto some corrugated roofs with rubbish thrown on top!). The tram runs really regularly, is clean and cheap, but always extremely busy. More often than not you will be standing (if you can even get on the tram at peak times) and the 15-minute journey ends up feeling like a commute. If you're a tourist then chances are you'll head into town during the day, come back to get changed and then head into town again to eat (as nightlife around the hotel isn't good) which means four tram trips. This quickly gets boring. 3. Be careful if booking a taxi through the hotel. We asked for two cabs to take us back to the airport and they had Barcelo Eresin written on the side. They tried to charge us 25 Turkish Lira more than was on the meter per cab (and 30 Lira more than we'd paid on arrival following the same route) to cover the tolls. As we'd seen the toll charges at each stopping point, this was vastly over-inflated. The exchange, during which they initially threatened us with the tourist police and then backed down when we stood our ground, left a really nasty taste and I would advise just flagging your own taxi down to ensure no hidden charges appear on your bill. Other minor points are the cost of breakfast and drinks at the hotel - they're high, but that's usual for 5* hotels. There is a Shell garage and a supermarket two minutes walk away if you want to get water or snacks at lower prices. And the hotel safe confused all six of us and we had to put three calls into Reception to come and reset the safes in all three rooms. None of us could find the reset button mentioned on the instructions and ended up locked out of our safes! The reset button is inside the safe door between the hinges if you're wondering!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Average...”
Reviews.Author: Shax
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would say that Istanbul is so friendly and enjoyable that it doesnt matter where you stay! Having said that... The hotel did look nice and the reception and breakfast are very nice. The Wi-Fi was brilliant in the room and we made many a free Skype call using it; this was a major plus. We did have to change room once as the bathroom noises from the next room were very audible and the at reception I was told that the walls are thin and even if we move we will still have the similar problem. Having moved we did find it quieter in the new room but then there was a problem with our bathroom! it kept flushing. An engineer did come and sort it out after a couple of hours or so. The location is as many other have stated; trams are opposite the hotel and allow you to mix with the locals but to be honest after a few trips you do wish you were closer to the action, i.e. the area around the Blue Mosque etc. This is because trams do get VERY busy at times and feels like your back in the UK commuting during work hours. There is a mosque literally around the corner and a supermarket, this was very handy for myself being a Muslim. Oh and the the indoor swimming pool was GREAT! Overall I would say it wasnt the worst stay ever but next time in Istanbul I will stay in an area closer to the center as there hotels that are their and not as noisy as people may tell you; so you get the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for hotels, trie Barcelo Eresin”
Reviews.Author: harakaki
Reviews.Content: I don't no if the value is good or not because the price included all (hotels, sightseeng and lunch) The negative point for me was the bathroom. Whem you are taking shower, because you don`t have a curtin to block the water, all bathroom stay wet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JZ77
Reviews.Content: Breakfast buffet is delicious and included w stay. Allowed early check in. Wi-Fi is free and fast. Excellent service and welcoming staffs. Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “A haven of cool and tranquility in a very hot humid city!”
Reviews.Author: Sionnw
Reviews.Content: A large clean well maintained hotel in an excellent location adjacent to the old city wall and opposite a tram station for all the main tourist attractions (1.5Tl). The hotel is set back off a busy major road, but once inside the hotel there was no traffic noise. The weather was extremely hot and humid during our visit and the very efficient air conditioning made the hotel extremely welcoming! The spacious reception/lobby area and mezzanine has ample comfortable seating, with a patisserie/bar available for coffee, drinks, snacks, and delicious (though rather small!) ice creams. The reception staff were polite and extremely helpful. The staff in the Picasso Restaurant were cheerful and attentive, the buffets had a good selection and the food we had was well cooked, very appetising and of a very good standard. The hotel has a well equipped wellness centre/spa and has the ultimate bonus of a hammam and massage - the latter was well worth the charge. Our bedroom was of very good size with large comfortable twin beds which were easily pushed together. The room and bathroom were very clean and toiletries etc were replenished daily, the mini-bar was well stocked. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the hotel, and would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, friendly people, SUPER-service and all the people are local!”
Reviews.Author: AmineBouhafs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three weeks, from Tuesday June 13th 2010 to Monday August 2nd 2010. I can tell you it was just "great" but, I'll also tell you why it was so "great", First of all, the trip got us so beat up that all we could long for was nothing but a comfortable bed. Barcelo Eresin Topkapi dlivered. Second we wanted to eat goooood. Barcelo Eresin Topkapi dlivered. Then me and my fionce (then) wanted to get married the traditional way. Barcelo Eresin Topkapi dlivered. We also wanted to go to a shopping centre which was bursting with quality and it had to be good priced. Barcelo Eresin Topkapi dlivered. And we wanted to visit very big old buildings like the Aya Sofia. Barcelo Eresin Topkapi dlivered. Barcelo Eresin Topkapi also dlivered when we needed a time-out from the crowd and come to rest with alot of things to eat and a drink. So when summer-time arrives we can only think of three words, "Barcelo Eresin Topkapi".

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable place to know Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: RPereira2008
Reviews.Content: I was at Barcelo Heresin for 2 nights in December 2009 and I loved it. The rooms are tidy and the restaurant has a big variety of food available. In spite of the hotel is a bit far from Istanbul city center it has a tram stop right in front the hotel that allows you to get anywhere without effort. The staff is very nice and helpful. My wife and I wanted to go to a 1001 nights dinner (we went to Sultana. It was a good show/dinner but in my opinion the dinner didn't worth the money we've paid) and they arranged everything.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Hotel for my US Guests”
Reviews.Author: CulturalFolkTours
Reviews.Content: I have been using this hotel since its opening for my Turkey cultural tours for US travelers. These travelers have always given high marks for the comfort, cleanliness, friendliness, security and food service. They are always happy to get non-smoking rooms and for the big swimming pool in the nice spa. Not all the staff is fluent in English but the Front Desk team and the management are always ready to help. All in all a very nice place for my US guests.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Arabia”
Reviews.Author: Mamzool
Reviews.Content: First I must make something crisp clear , I do not have anything against the Arab community , I think Arab people are among the most honest people on the planet and although I have some difficulty understanding their manners please do not consider my review based on a racist perspective: This was my third visit to barcelo eresin ,as usual everything was cool ,they gave us an early checkin ,they even gave us a club premium room which I really appreciated ,every thing is handled professionally at the hotel and every demand is fulfilled in a polite and professional way. Unfortunately I don't know why but the hotel was dedicated to Arab people this time . I really think the management should avoid such a monopoly , I really prefer a melting pot when I travel so I could understand and make friends with different races and nationalities. In my opinion Arab people have some issues I really dont like : First of all they are very loud people and although they are typically kind ,they make the impression they are rude and aggressive .My second issue is that they do not control their kids properly , at breakfast screaming and crying of kids made me quite nuts and it was the same scenario every day so although my room rate included breakfast I didn't have breakfast a few days . But my worst experience was some guy shouting madly at the reception desk which made my wife terrified.Although the people at the reception handled the situation calmly the shouting went on for 5 to 6 minutes and it somehow ruined my holiday in Istanbul ,because my wife has a heart condition and she was terrified and speechless for sometime and didnt recover fully for the rest of our trip.So three months of waiting and planning carefully for this vacation trip was ruined by this incident . I certainly wont go back to Barcelo Eresin if this Arabic monopoly continues because I cannot afford to ruin another vacation mentally and financially and above all it would take some time for my wife to recover the shock and its consequences.

Reviews.Title: “High Expections - Poor Result”
Reviews.Author: zouavepa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property in 2006 - great stay in room 465. Came back after "rennovation" and new owners and was very disappointed. Asked for the same jounior suite I had in 2006. While it was upgraded (flat screen TV, mini-bar, furniture) the room had many problems: (1) there are no non-smoking rooms in the hotel and 465 smelled like a RJR convention was held in it the night before (it litterally gagged us). Called house keeping who sprayed the room - helped for about one hour the stank again. (2) The suite had a connecting door installed and we had an Arab family staying in the room next door who were arguing in Farzi all night. Complained to front desk to no avail (spent the night with earplugs). (3) This property is not US friendly - many evil looks to my wife who dressed in pants and did not have a scarf on in the dining room. (4) The gym is a sweat shop with little of no AC. (5) Food service and quality was very poor (scrambled eggs in am looke like half cooked) while prices very inflated. Worst hotel stay i have ever had..

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel but location is not good.”
Reviews.Author: neutronSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay but I definitely wouldnt recommend it because there would be many similar hotels in better locations. We are a young couple and wanted to be closer to the action - the hotel is about 8 tram stops to the busy parts of the old city and about another 8 stops to the new city. Everyone else staying at the hotel was in big tour groups with average age in their 50s or 60s. Also, our first night there was a wedding in one of their function rooms and we could hear the music clearly from our room until at least 11.30 (not what we wanted after a busy day flying to Turkey and touring the city for hours).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Lluis
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Barcelo Eresin Topkapi Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel is beautiful, nice rooms, really confortable beds and amazing swimming pool, sauna and gym. The staff is kind and helpful. The breakfast was delicious: continental breakfast, typical turkish breakfast and also pa amb tomÃ quet amb pernil (bread, tomato and ham - typical delicious Catalan food) and "churros" (Spanish breakfast), tea, coffee, chocolate, yoghourts, fruits... There are three computers with free internet. There is a tramway station in front of the hotel. It's name is PAZARTEKKE.
