You can buy the tickets in the Kiosk who is in front the station and reach the old Istanbul in ten minutes (Blue Mosque, Sta Sofia, Gran Bazar...). I recommend you this hotel in Istanbul. I booked it by internet in www.barcelo.com

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAFF”
Reviews.Author: muslimbrother
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel made even more wonderful by the fantastic management team. A special thank you goes to the F/O Manager Safi who helped make everything worthwhile. The Hotel is equal in quality to other five star hotels in the main tourist areas but the price (because of its location) is much better. It has a fantastic gym & very nice spa, together with sauna steam room, large swimming pool & Turkish bath. It also has a Prayer room, which was very useful, & there is a small mosque within 100yds of the hotel. I used the hotel facilities each morning and never got bored. For swimming pool usage a swimming cap must be used (5euros for cap) the location is slightly out the way for tourists visiting the Sultan-Ahmed district, however there is a fantastic tram service outside the hotel, which runs every 5 mins to the main tourist sites. (1.5 lira one-way regardless of distance). There are approx 6 stops before you get to blue mosque. 20mins journey. I strongly recommend that anyone who wishes to get a feel for Istanbul commute via tram as you get to admire the local areas in and around Sultan â€“Ahmed District. Besides if you wish to do a spot of shopping the tram stops at several stops and all along the routes there are hundreds of shops selling anything and everything. However a point to note is the tram gets very busy during peak times so be warned. Our experience of Istanbul was beyond our expectations; our treatment was 5 star and once again thanks to the guys at our hotel. Also a mention about Osman the (bellboy), great lad and very helpful as always. The hotel does provide a map to the main places and just ask the front desk guys and they will help direct you. We stayed for 7 nights and spent it as follows: Day1: visited the Blue Mosque (a must see wonder) & Hagi Sofia (also recommended) blue mosque has no entrance fee but Hagia Sofia is 10lira per person. From our hotel its approx 6stops and once you get off at Sultan-Ahmed itâ€™s a further 5mins walk. You canâ€™t miss it as the magnificent buildings tower above the skyline. Day2: Visited Topkapi Palace (must see wonder) entrance fee is 20lira. The location is towards the right side of Hagia Sofia, it is not well signposted so donâ€™t panic if you cant find it just ask someone. You will need approx 3-4 hrs here; it gets very busy with tourists and bring a good camera. (Just a note you cannot take pics inside the Haram as it holds some sacred Islamic items. For Muslims this place is not to be missed. The surrounding courtyards are an ideal place to have a picnic. The views are fab. Day3: Bosporus Cruise, get the tram to Eminuno, get off and go under small subway and once out, itâ€™s towards your right side. You wont miss it, as a number of boats are ready waiting to take people on cruises. Donâ€™t take the commercial ferries, as they will only do a short cruise, get a medium sized boat and it costs 10lira for a 1.5hr cruise. We caught a boat which had BOGAZ24.COM splashed across it. The cruise itself is wonderful you get to see many places of interest on the way around, again take a good camera. & Remember to take a jumper as it can get Cold. Also take some food, as there is not much choice on board. Tea sellers are about and a cup is 1lira. Day4: Eyup: This place is perhaps one of the most wonderful places to visit if you want to chill out, away from the hordes of tourists. Best way to get here is by taxi and the cost from our hotel was 8lira. There is a Mosque called Ayuub Sultan (Companion of Prophet Mohammed). This place is of immense value to Muslims as the grave of Abu Ayuub Ansari is here. Once done from the mosque take a Teleflex (cable cart) (1.5lira each way) to Pier Loti, where you have amazing views of the Bosporus. You can take a coffee here and just admire the views. You could spend a whole day in Eyup, as there are also many small shops around to keep you busy. Prices here are better than the main Sultan-Ahmed District. Day5: Princes Islands, there are a series of 5 islands, the largest and most touristy is Buyukada, however we chose to go to Heybeliada. To get here you will need to get a ferryboat from KABATAS. To get to Kabatas a tram will be best as it goes direct. The ferry costs 3lira per person one-way and tickets can be purchased from the station. This island is the 4th island and it is a 2hr ferry ride. You will get an announcement at every stop, however only in Turkish so you have to count the stops yourself. Once you get here you can just relax, take in the magnificent views, go to one of many small shops and just chill. There are no cars on this island so travel is via cycle or horse and carriage. A 40mins tour on horse and carriage will cost 35lira, prices are non negotiable. Or you could hire a bike (not sure of costs). Nevertheless you can spend an entire day here admiring the island. Day 6: Grand Bazaar, this is a place to go if you are prepared to walk and walk. To get here you can get a tram, which is the 2nd or 3rd stop after blue mosque stop. They call it Grand for a good reason, it has more than 4000 shops, however everyone seems to sell the same thing, which is annoying, and the prices are touristy prices, so no deals here. I wouldnâ€™t recommend taking children, as the walks can be long. Nevertheless a visit to Istanbul isnâ€™t complete without a bazaar tour. Day 7: Underground Cistarn, built around 532ad itâ€™s no ore than a place, which holds water. It has its history, however Iâ€™d stay away from here, as there is nothing to see but columns upon columns. The ticket price is 10lira. The last day was spent shopping around; we bought some nice souvenirs and spent it walking around the main Sultan-Ahmed area enjoying a picnic. We visited the new mosque at Eminuno, had fish sandwich from one of many fishing boats. (fish is highly recommended).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Joker79London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here hoping to have a little luxury in Istanbul and were disappointed. The hotel is quite far from the major sites (thought the tram stops outside) and everything was a bit sterile and impersonal. There are far better hotels close to the sites. There was also a wedding on the night we stayed which meant that we listened to extremely loud music for most of the night when trying to get soem sleep for an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DelMedio
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed here for 5 days at the start of April. I thought the hotel was very nice but not exactly 5 star...maybe a great 4 star hotel. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful at all times. The room was very comfortable and the free wifi was excellent. The hotel is itself is a bit out from the main attractions but there is a tram right outside the door which will bring you right to the heart of the tourist area in about 15-20 mins. If i was going back to Istanbul i would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only few staff spoke English, definitely not 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSunshine15
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotel was OK, only 10 minutes on a tram (tramvay) to main historic atractions of Istanbul. Airport is not far away either - it took me 1 hour when I arrived and 45 minutes when I was living (although staff at the hotel told me that it takes only 15 minutes!!!!). One thing that I think it was very disapointing is that only few staff at supposingly 5* international hotel spoke English. The girl in the shop and the girl at the swimming pool reception spoke very good English and that's about it! I really struggle to explain to the staff what I want so that they understood me. When I arrived, I noticed there is no tooth brush/paste in the room (I am used to 5* hotels where usually tooth brush/paste is provided in the room hence I didn't bring it with me). It was 11pm. When I called the housekeeping and ask for tooth paste then struggle to understand what I am asking for. After 15 minutes someone called me from the kitchen and asked me which spices I ordered!?!?!?!? When I explained that I am looking for tooth paste they just put me through the reception. I explained again and it seems like they understood what I am looking for. Half an hour later nobody came to my room so I called again. Overwall I waited 1 hour for the tooth brush and paste to be delivered. Toalets are not the best as sometimes it would flush, sometimes you would have to try 5-6 times to get it to flush. As someone else commented they are very stingy with giving out soap and other amedeties in the bathroom. I was given one soop on the first day and it wasn't replaced at all till the end. I had breakfast every morning in the Picasso restaurant and I though it was great. There were so many different varieties of food which was a plus. They would change the menu daily which I though it was great. However service at the restaurant was very poor. When I was there the hotel was very busy and waiters at the restaurant probably didn't used to the that so they just couldn't cope. They wouldn't clear the tables fast, they never offer me a coffee or tea, I had to chace them for it as well as milk and sugar! Usually milk would be at the table and sugar but becasue it was busy there was nothing there. The same scanario happened every morning for 4 days. Only on the 5th day when the restaurant was quite empty I was given coffee straight away. Again they didn't speak English becasue when I aked for knife (there was none on my table) they didn't know what I am aking for and they had to call the manager. There is no proper consiarge service which was very negative side. People at the reception spoke so little English that they couldn't really give you any advice even if you ask them. Although I was there on business I wanted to explore Istanbul a little bit and there was no advice or suggestions which was a shame. I had to do reserach by myself and also find my own way to the city centre and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “don't look any further”
Reviews.Author: Youssef-orlando
Reviews.Content: Words can not express my splendid trip to Istanbul on my birthday and thanks to Barcelo eresin topkapi I had the best trip ever. Before going to istanbul I did so many research about the area and its hotels. I end up choosing Barcelo and I did the perfect choice. I would like to express a special thanks to Mr Juan Miralles, the operation manager, who once I checked-in I was sent a nice chocolate cake as a gift for my birthday, that was a very nice gesture to start my vacation with. Most of the reception desk team are very friendly and yes they do speak descent english, you just have to be patient as they will do their best to listen to your request, respond back and accomodate you. remember you're not in the U.S so when people speak to you in english that's a plus. I did call many times for extra blankets and keys and they were delivered in no time. the hotel is more likely a 4 star to the US standards. Yet, the ameneties are just amazing, they have indoor swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna, steaming room and Turkish Hammam, what else can you ask for. some people were complaining the hotel si too far. my answer is if you want to be in taksim or beyoglu area then good luck with that. first those areas are way too noisy, second most of taksim hotels dont have half of the amenities that barcelo has, if yes they charge you triple what barcelo does. Barcelo is located at topkapi area, very safe and quiet, 2 minutes away from the tramway...I dont think I ever spent more that 5 minutes wait time and it cost a 1.50 lira which is about a dollar, it will take you to sultanahmet 10 min taksim 20 min and it is a lovely ride as you get to see the whole city and experience it with locals. There is also a supemarket 2 minutes away where you can get water and juices cheap. just make sure you buy a swimming cap in advance as you will need that for the swimming pool. again thanks Mr Juan Mirales and the whole barcelo team for making my trip a memorable one and I will definitely book Barcelo again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Icecreamcherry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during our 5 days visit to Istambul and had the best experience in such a different country for us mexicans. All the people at the hotel were so friendly, helpful with information and suggestions. Explaining and giving advice of what to do and the best way of doing it. Specially Mr. Mithat Unaldi at the front desk was so nice, and as he also speaks spanish, helped us a lot to make our vacations so special and unique. The food at the restaurant was so good and the internet always available. Very close to a tram station.

Reviews.Title: “Spanish details at Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GGZ
Reviews.Content: We were here for Christmas holidays and the hotel was nicely decorated. The hotel is rated 5*, but is not so spectacular, it is comfortable and quiet, you will only hear mornig call to prayer from the near Mosque. Being Spanish, you may feel a little bit at home because there are some Spanish details at breakfast buffet, you may find quite a lot of Spaniards staying at the hotel and hotel staff can understand you. The bad point is that except from the tram station, there's nothing around and you cannot reach any turistic place on foot. If you choose to stay here, just bear in mind that you may depend on the tram (20 min. to Sultanahmet).

Reviews.Title: “If you wish comfortable and peaceful stay, you may choose”
Reviews.Author: sabonroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one more time before, because of that stay i could booked hotel from internet with my barcelo option and got discount. Reception department is very interested, and polite. Check in was completed in a minute. My wife and i had two backpacks and didn't need for bellboy help. Room is very well decorated, both in bedroom and bathroom. Bed is very comfortable. Bathroom has everyhing you may need, even shaving set, toothbush and toothpaste. Tramway and bus station is very near, one minute with walking. There was two pairs of slippers and i liked most. Both hotel and room are very clean. TV wasn't lcd, it was disadvantage if you may care. I wish that room would be larger some.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks! DEFINITELY NOT A 5 STAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: abbey_315
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. First of all, this hotel is nowhere NEAR a 5 star hotel! I will say from the exterior, and the lobby, we expected the rooms and service to be much better... we were disappointed. When we arrived at noon, we were asked to come back in an hour and a half because our room wasn't ready. No big deal, we walked a few blocks down and ate lunch and walked through the shopping area. When we came back to check in, the clerk at the front desk asked about our room preferences, which were also chosen when the room was booked-- non-smoking, one double bed. Well, first they put us in a room with two single beds, so we called and asked to be moved to a room with one double bed. Then, we were put into a room with a double bed, but this time it was a smoking room, yuck. So, we called yet again, and finally got a non-smoking room with a double bed. The attendant that they sent up acted like it was an inconvenience for him, and then lingered like he was waiting around for a tip... sorry, we were not in the mood to tip after having to shuffle around to 3 different rooms! The room: The room stunk! It smelled like it had been a smoking room and they shampooed the carpets. There was a lingering odor. The carpets did not look like they had been vacuumed after the last guests left; there were visible crumbs of some sort on the carpet. The room just didn't seem like it was maintained very well in general. One day we had purchased a bag of chips, and I dropped a piece of chip on the floor accidentally. I said to my husband, "I think I'll just leave it there and see if they actually vacuum." When we returned later, my husband took a bottle of water out of a grocery sack that we had of snacks and said "well, here's the chip", instead of vacuuming the chip up, they decided to put it into our grocery sack... The bathroom: The water pressure in the shower was a complete JOKE!!! When you turned the hot water on in the tub it literally trickled out, so, if you wanted more pressure, you would have to turn on the cold water really high. Take your pick-- either a hot shower that drips out, or a cold shower with some (not good) water pressure. Additionally, the glass shower divider door would not stay closed, so water got all over the bathroom. The toilet was hit or miss! Sometimes it would flush, sometimes you would have to try 4 times to get it to flush. My husband and I commented that we had never stayed at a hotel and actually run out of soap... they are very stingy with giving out soap-- we were given one tiny bar during the time that we stayed there which was evidently to be used at both the sink and in the shower, and that we used up completely. Thank goodness I didn't choose to pay for the hotel breakfast everyday when I booked the room! We didn't eat the hotel breakfast until the very last morning, after we checked out and were on our way to the airport. I walked through, and thought that it might be good based upon the signs next to the chafing dishes. I thought perhaps the breakfast was the saving grace of the hotel... NO! We paid about $50 for the two of us for a TERRIBLE breakfast! We had NO service, I mean NONE! We had to flag someone down to give us coffee, then not a single one of our plates was cleared from the table, we just had to stack them up, and on a small two person table, that doesn't leave much room for anything else. The bacon was cold, not just lukewarm, literally cold, as in it was pre-cooked, just came out of the refrigerator and the fat had congealed on it. The scrambled eggs were just runny mush and tasted like they were strictly egg yolks. There were little scoops of mashed potatoes-- obviously frozen, packaged stuff-- they were hard on the outside and ice cold on the inside. Then, there were "mixed omlettes" which were just thin pieces of burned eggs... what the heck? It was as if they just poured egg onto a griddle, let it over cook, then threw it in the dish to serve. There was a reasonable selection of fruit, and fruit juices. One guy asked me where I got the bacon; I pointed and told him it's really cold as if it just came out of the refrigerator and he said "well, you either eat, or you don't eat." Clearly, he was on one of the tour groups who were locked into eating that breakfast every morning. When we were done we were beyond upset with our stay at the hotel in general, and the breakfast which cost us about $50 was just the icing on the cake. $50 for breakfast is fairly pricey in the U.S. but about what you would expect to pay at a 5 star hotel for breakfast, so for $50 in Turkey, you would expect a damn good breakfast... NO. We didn't use the pool, but it looked pretty nice. It was crowded when we walked through. My husband got a massage which he thought was not very good. We actually liked the location of the hotel. We were glad to be out of the completely touristy areas. We spent one night in Sultanhamet, so we felt like we got that experience. The tramway is right outside of the door, and it's about a 10 minute ride to Sultanhamet for about $1.50 per person/ per ride. The tramway will also take you close to most of the attractions. The other nice thing was that there was a Shell gas station right next to the hotel, so we would stop there every day to get bottled water and snacks. The bottled water there was .50 Turkish lira compared to some absurd amount that they were charging at the hotel-- something like 4 Turkish lira. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? No. I'm sure there are MUCH better options! The staff in general seemed like they had a chip on their shoulders, and were not eager to help, and the facilities need to be updated. Not to mention the terrible, overpriced breakfast. The only plus was that we had wireless internet access for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the surroundings...”
Reviews.Author: Made4areason
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and the staff were amazing helpful pointing out stuff on the map for us. The free 'hi speed internet' barely worked though, you had to go out into the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Loved the modern, well decorated, spacious rooms. Breakfast with huge selection of fruits, yogurt and just about everything one may wish. Friendly staff, although they should improve their English knowledge. A bit too far from Taksim/Sultanahmet, tourist areas. Luckily taxis are inexpensive in Istanbul. A good choice if you want a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Comfort, Good Location Without Costing The Sky”
Reviews.Author: AzizRashidSingapore
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 young children (10 and 6) stayed at the hotel from 18 June 2009 to 24 June 2009. Prior to the trip I spent a lot of time on the net searching for a hotel in Istanbul, a city we were visiting for the 1st time. I was at first very tempted to book one of the hotels around the Sultahahmet or Sirkeci areas (near the attractions) but found that many did not have a pool (a must for my children). Those that did have pools were too expensive. I came across the Eresin Topkapi in one of my searches on this site. It met most of my criteria and the price was good. Of course there were good reviews. I was a little apprehensive by some comments about the hotel being 'far away' from the attractions. Having considered all factors, I decided to 'take a risk' and booked the hotel online via Barcelo's site. On our arrival, we were pleasantly greeted by the hotel's very nice facade. Oh yes, we got a free transfer too! The stay at the hotel was all I expected (and wanted) and more! The kids loved the pool. My wife enjoyed the jacuzzi and I managed to do my laps at the pool. The sauna was great too. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we wanted only halal. The front desk staff was always ready to help with directions. I was pleasantly surprised to find an envelope under the room door soon after we checked-in. In it was a prayer time schedule for the period of our stay. As for location, the tram station in front of the hotel was very convenient. We hopped on a tram every day to get to the attraction sites (even to as far as Taksim). All the attractions were located along the tram line. The major modern shopping centres are not too far too by metered-taxi (which does not cost much anyway) As for food, we were spoilt for choice from the many restaurants and food outlets within 3 minutes walk from the hotel. I must add that the Premier Club Room we stayed in was superb. Very spacious, very clean with a good view of the front of the hotel. I have travelled quite a bit and I must say that I got more than what I paid for here at the Eresin Topkapi. It was definitely value for money. If you want luxury, comfort and good location without costing you the sky, you must give this hotel a try. You will arrive with a smile and leave with an even bigger one! My thanks to the staff and management of the Barcelo Eresin Topkapi. One thing for sure, wherever else I travel to in the future I will look out for a Barcelo hotel. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfactory hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRLM
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 5th floor, we were 4 adults in 2 rooms. We booked B&B. The hotel staff were always helpful and courteous. Breakfast was plentiful, with a good variety that changed slightly each day. The rooms were clean and towels changed daily. Water pressure was excellent. Safe included with room. Spa was clean and pleasant. We ate in the hotel one night and the meal was excellent. The waiter very attentive. The only 3 areas of concern were 1) a lack of aircon - the building got very hot during the day and so our rooms became stuffy, and 2) the traffic noise outside due to it's location on Millet Street, 3) poor bar service - 2xbeers on separate nights included a fly in each and a "Macallan Whisky" that wasn't. These were not major problems and though we were offered a move to the back of the hotel (no view) we stayed put. After reading some very negative comments on Trip Advisor, I was apprehensive when booking this hotel. Just inside the old city walls, but well outside the centre, the remote location has its benefits. There are no mosques within earshot so our sleep was never disturbed by the call to prayers. And the tram stops outside the hotel so with regular service Sultanamet is only 10 minutes away. I have no real complaint at all about Barcelo Eresin and would happily stay there again if visiting Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: manubrio
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, not expensive, a little far from the touristic zone but with all the facilities you need

Reviews.Title: “My adventure at Barcelo Eresin Topkapi”
Reviews.Author: mstraveler24
Reviews.Content: Barcelo Eresin Topkapi was beautiful but a bit pricey. I stayed for a few days coming from San Diego California. They coudn't find my reservation right away but they tried to accomodate me. Some of the reception spoke English which was great but lack of communication on my reservations which was booked. I loved the breakfast and the restaurant. The food was superb. They have a nice swimming pool spa with a mural. The healthclub was nice. The gentleman there gave me the necessary stuff like towels locker room and shower cap. I like the wireless internet in every room and the little area where they have internet access although it was difficult using a computer that was taylored for usa. Some of the reception guys were sharp with my receipts and what i was spending but too strict when it came to questioning my guest and his reservation. I felt it was rude.. They questioned my guest many times and although my guest paid for his room he kept getting questioned which annoyed me. I did not even see the manager of the hotel when requested on clarifying the reservation issue. i was still accomadated but was inconvenienced having to keep insisting that my reservation is paid for and booked. Lack of training on the hotel staff and their computers. I kept asking for a plug outlet for my computer yet they kept giving me one that didnt' work. Finally one of the guest helped me in requesting. I love the little lounge and had expresso there. The light was dim but you could see the local shops down the street. The Christmas decorations were beautiful and the lobby area was nice. They made sure my bags were brought up and the turkish literature was fine. Though my view was of someone's backyard it was ok. The bathrooms were beautiful complete with everything. I enjoyed my stay because if was part of my memorable adventure, i just don't like the inconvenience that i had to go through with the staff sometimes in the reservation. But not all the staff was bad. The restaurant was wonderful and very organized and clean. The food was served great and the decor marvelous. I liked the gym though small it did have most of the equiptment. The pool look just as good as the photos. I would recommend this place but it is pricey and to make sure that you become more assertive in making sure your reservations are confirmed because for some reason they have conflicting information on the computer. YOu have to tell them everything you want or they will not help. They won't always smile but they will try to see what can be done. If you have patience then fine. Some of the women staff were rude but most of the male staff were accomodating. Trying to get them to smile was a challenge. The guests were very nice. I don't recommend this to anyone who is on a budget or has no patience. lol I do recommend this hotel for those seeking visual stimulation from the beautiful decor, the exotic name, the prompt room service, The hotel though was very beautiful but i've also been to comparable 5 star hotels with the same set up. The mini bar was organized and i love the slippers and the different services being offered. I love the literature on turkey, the massage treatments, and baths.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, But Far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: i-gots-wanderlust
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within the old city walls of Istanbul, but it is by no means anywhere close to the city center. There aren't many restaurants around, but it's only saving grace is that the metro stop is directly in front of the hotel. There are three computers with free internet access on the 2nd floor. Ask for a room on floors 3-5, as they are cleaner and newer than the rooms on floors 1 and 2. The rooms facing the front of the hotel can be a bit noisy if you leave the balcony door open, but it's not unbearable (but then again, I am not a light sleeper). The bathrooms are a decent size and comes equipped with a good hairdryer and toiletries (including toothbrush & toothpaste and a shaving kit). The hotel restaurant is OK, but over priced, so it's best to hop on the metro and head into Taxim.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: Moe_XII
Reviews.Content: Usually where I'm staying during vacation constitute a big chunk of the vacation experience, therefore Barcelo Topkapi as a hotel adds little to the overall experience. (-ve) The breakfast is identical daily (for 7 days) (+ve) The staff can comprehend English. (-ve) I requested hot water and they charged me for it 5YTL=4$ (+ve) The health club is different, but not different from other Turkish ones. (-ve) Room amenities are non. (-ve) Limited tourist information available at the hotel. (-ve) late check-out time is 1300 (-ve) I arrived at 900 am and I kept waiting till 1100. (+ve) The location is steps away from bus & Tram stations which can get you almost anywhere (-ve) The location is at the far end of happening places, so if you are looking for downtown location this is not the one. And next to a hospital, hence, the never ending sirens of ambulances.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price. Perfect for us but out of the way for tourists”
Reviews.Author: dmsgrl
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. It is equal in quality to the five star hotels in the main tourist areas but the price (because of its location) is much better. It has a very nice spa. I highly recommend that you indulge in the traditional Turkish soap massage. For tourists, there is no doubt that it is out of the way of the main sights. We hired a private guide who picked us up each day so this was not an issue for us. If you are going to rely on public transportation or taxis and your object is sightseeing, it MIGHT be better to select a hotel near the sights even if it means one with a lower rating. There is a tram that runs directly in front of the hotel and will take you right to all the tourist sights. I never took it but it certainly looked convenient and ran very frequently. I noticed it was very, very crowded during rush hour, but as long as you avoided rush hour it is probably a great way to get around. The traffic in Istanbul is horrendous. However, if you are there for business or if you plan on hiring a driver or taking the tram, than this is an excellent property. It's quiet, safe, clean, classy, beautiful restaurant and spa and very friendly and attentive staff. Do include the breakfast in your reservation if possible as it is well worth it. We were very happy with our choice and would definitely stay there again. This is the second Barcelo property I've stayed in (I stayed in one in Cancun last Spring) and I am very impressed with their properties thus far. Wit the tram, it could be an excellent way to stay in a very nice property for a good price and still have access to what you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey & out of the way”
Reviews.Author: mramo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only 1 night. It was a pleasant experience. The rooms are nice though a little dated (eg. the hair dryer is old & not very powerful, the minibar is still extremely over priced in a way that few hotels are nowadays). The location is also a little out of the way & not within walking distance of major attractions. But overall, the service was good & the room was comfortable. It's thus not a surprise, that most of the travellers staying there are from large organized tour groups. We saw many large groups of the checking in & departing during our stay. At least they have the big tour buses to transport them to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great week-end at Barcelo Eresin Topkapi”
Reviews.Author: Ellie33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long week-end at the Barcelo Eresin Topkapi and had a wonderful time. The hotels seems to have been renovated recently: the rooms are modern, spacious and very clean. We had a junior suite on the club level facing a little garden that was particularly quiet for such a big city. The hotel staff -from the reception desk to housekeeping- was very courteous, efficient and eager to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Although we arrived quite late (2:30 am) and left very early, several people were there to assist us with our luggage and transportation. The hotel staff was also very helpful in assisting us with restaurant reservations as well as suggestions for sightseeing and shopping. Although the hotel is not within walking distance from the major sights, these are easily reachable by taxi or tram which stops right in front of the hotel. Traffic can be very heavy in Istanbul and the tram is a good option during peak hours as it will take only 10-15 minutes to reach the Topkapi Palace area. The pool and the spa were very nice and clean and we do regret that we did not have enough time to use the health club. Overall, the hotel seems to be extremely well run and we can recommend it without hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelo Eresin is great”
Reviews.Author: Frli
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barcelo Eresin nn the dates 21-25 June, 2008. I had my 4 year old daughter with me. The hotel itself is good and very clean. However, the infrastructure of the hotel is far from the hotels we used to visit in the Antalya coast. The service is much better then in the Alntalya hotels. Rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast in well worth its cost of 15 Euros. They did charge a breakfast fee for my 4 year old child. When I booked my hotel I did not include a breakfast, indeed you can have a breakfast on have it billed to your room in daily basis. I did it this way just because sometimes I miss my breakfast hours therefore I don't want to pay if I don't use it. The lobby bar prices and mini bar prices are way to high. A beer costs 16 Lira (9 Euro). A 0.5L bottle of water 5 lira. Instead there is a nerby shop called Mavi File around 150 meters away where you can get your drinks at market prices. The pool is open from 7AM until 10PM which is very convenient. However make sure you bring a swimming cap with you if you don't want to buy it at the hotel for 10 YTL (6 Euro). Also you can not use you cell phones in the pool area and swimming in the main pool is prohibited for children under 12. One of the most useful things is that hotel has 3 yellow taxis that can take you anywhere with a regular taxi metered fare. Being a hotel taxi, you are sure that you will not be driven around to be overcharged as you always have a place to address you dissatisfaction. Although taxis were always busy driving hotel guests around, I never had to wait more than 5 minutes until the taxis were back in front of the hotel. Beware that elevators are not air conditioned therefore during 1 minute of their use you can get extremely hot and sweat. Hotel has also a security gate which happens to be very annoying is it always beeps when you enter or exit the gate. Non of the security staff ever stopped anyone therefore I don't see a point of having a hotel gate with metal detector. You can also change currency at the hotel but at a rate 5% lower than elsewhere therefore make sure you don't change large amounts of money at the hotel. Overall, the hotel is not a 5 star hotel but rather a 4 star one, which is still not bad for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, ambience and lovely helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: travelorCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The people at reception were terrific. They were very helpful in assisting me even w/the most minor of problems. The breakfast buffet is one of the best! The food is varied and excellent, both in the resturant and the lobby cafe. They also have a great shop Inci 2 Seramik where you can buy lots of great items, small or large purchases. I had a minor complaint with a service and my bill was adjusted most fairly. The maid service and bellman service was above reproach. I would go back there any time.

HotelInfo.Name: Barcelo Eresin Topkapi
HotelInfo.Address: Millet Caddesi 186, Istanbul 34104, Turkey
